name: Big 8 Football History Quiz | NCAA Football | 10 Questions

questions.text: The conference which became known as the Big 8 was formed in 1907 under what name?
questions.explanation:
Missouri Valley Intercollegiate Athletic Association.

	The MVIAA began play in 1907 with 5 charter members. Iowa and Nebraska shared the first conference title.

questions.text: Which 2 colleges joined the conference in 1908?
questions.explanation:
Iowa State and Drake.

	Washington (Mo) were one of the charter members from 1906, Grinnell joined in 1919, whilst none of the other schools mentioned were ever members of the Big 8.

questions.text: Which charter member left in 1910 to join the Big 10?
questions.explanation:
Iowa.

	Iowa were members for just 3 years. None of the other schools mentioned were ever members of the Big 8.

questions.text: Which school dominated the conference championship in the years leading up to America's involvement in World War I, winning or sharing all 8 titles from 1910 to 1917?
questions.explanation:
Nebraska.

	Nebraska were charter members in 1907, and were undefeated in conference play from 1910-15. Kansas State joined the Big 8 in 1913, Oklahoma in 1920, and Oklahoma State in 1925.

questions.text: In 1928, the old MVIAA disappeared when 6 members, Iowa State, Kansas, Kansas State, Missouri, Nebraska, and Oklahoma, broke away to form the new Big 6. Which new conference was formed by the remaining members?
questions.explanation:
Missouri Valley Conference.

	The MVC existed fom 1928 until 1985, when Tulsa were the last-ever champions.

questions.text: The Big 6 became the Big 7 in 1948 with the addition of which school?
questions.explanation:
Colorado.

	The Colorado Buffaloes were members of the Mountain States Athletic Conference before joining the Big 7. The won their first title in 1961 under coach Sonny Grandelius.

questions.text: The Big 7 finally became the Big 8 in 1960 when which fomer MVIAA member returned to the fold?
questions.explanation:
Oklahoma State.

	The Oklahoma State Cowboys had played as an independent for 3 years from 1957-59 after leaving the MVC. They won their first share of a conference title in 1976.

questions.text: Which Big 8 member won 3 national titles in the 1950s?
questions.explanation:
Oklahoma.

	The Oklahoma Sooners under coach Bud Wilkinson were one of the dominant schools in college football during the 1950s with 12 consecutive outright Big 8 titles from 1947-59, and 4 Orange Bowl triumphs.

questions.text: Which school won the last ever Big 8 title in 1995?
questions.explanation:
Nebraska.

	The Nebraska Cornhuskers were a perfect 12-0 in 1995, going on to defeat Florida 62-24 in the Fiesta Bowl and be named consensus national champions.

questions.text: Following the 1995 season, the Big 8 ceased to exist when 4 members of the Southwest Conference joined the eight Big 8 schools to form which new conference?
questions.explanation:
Big 12.

	Baylor, Texas, Texas A&M, and Texas Tech joined the eight Big 8 members to form the brand new Big 12 in 1996.
